Su historia empezó cuando inicio prestado su servicio de limpieza a sus amigas de ay en adelante poco a poco continuo prestando sus servicios, lavando ropa. Su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es formar su propia empresa de limpieza. Por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar sus servicios de limpieza de ropa comprando una lavadora y detergentes.
texts.en: Ángela is a 35 year old woman and she hopes to do well in her job of washing clothes in the coming years. Her story began when she started providing a cleaning service for her friends and from there she gradually continued offering her services by washing clothes. She works alone and has no difficulties. She isn’t married and she has children. Her most important dream is to start up her own cleaning company. Therefore she wants the loan to improve her laundry service, by purchasing a washing machine and detergent.

loans.use: to buy detergent and a washing machine

loans.name: Shirle Piedad Romero Espinoza

texts.es: Shirle es una mujer de 40 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller estilista. Su historia empezó cuando cogió esta actividad de belleza y maquillaje. Le gustaba el estudio en casos de bellezas por eso en la actualidad su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar su vivienda. Por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar su local del salon de belleza comprando cemento, arena, pinturas.
texts.en: Shirle is a 40-year old woman, and she has great aspirations in the next few years to make her beauty salon a success.  Her history began when she started in this business of beauty and makeup. She liked the study of beauty, and she carries out her current work alone.  She has some difficulties, which are delinquencies.  She is married, has children, and her most important dream is finishing her home.   For this reason, she would like the loan in order to improve her beauty salon site, purchasing cement, sand, and paints.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paints.

loans.name: Herminia Yenny Fajardo Sanchez

texts.es: Herminia es una mujer de 46 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de cosméticos su historia empezó vendiendo zapatillas y cosméticos a las amigas del novio me gusta el comercio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener mi propio local y algunos empleados para dar trabajo a mis personas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas, materia prima para zapatillas y asi mejorar su ingresos.
texts.en: Herminia is a 46-year old woman, and she has great aspirations in the next few years to make her cosmetics sales business a success.  Her history began when she started selling slippers and cosmetics to the friends of her boyfriend.  She enjoys commerce, and she carries out her current work alone.  She has some difficulties, which are delinquencies.  She is single, has children, and her most important dream is having her own locale and some employees in order to provide work for her people.  For this reason, she would like the loan in order to buy perfumes, creams, and raw materials for slippers so she can improve her income.

loans.use: to acquire perfumes, creams, and raw materials for slippers.

loans.name: Orlando Teodulfo Rivera

texts.es: Orlando es un hombre de 35 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su panadería su historia empezó cuando aprendió pastelería y panadería y decido incursionar en el negocio, el trabajo lo hace con su esposa, no tiene dificultades, está casado, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es seguir estable con su negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su panadería y asi comprar azucar, harina, bebidas etc.
texts.en: Orlando is a 35-year old man, and he has great aspirations in the next few years to make his bakery business a success.  His history began when he learned cake and bread making, and he decided to start a business.  He carries out his work with his wife.  He doesn’t have any difficulties, is married, has children, and his most important dream is to continue forward with a stable business.  For this reason, he would like a loan for his bakery in order to buy sugar, flour, beverages, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his locale such as sugar, flour, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria Natividad

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 42 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida. Su historia empezó cuando se me ocurre vender meriendas los fines de semana ya que como cocino para mi puedo poner un poquito más y vender y sacar provecho para mi familia, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener bien surtido mi local y trabajar todos los días y ayudando a mi familia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comidas y asi poder comprar vitrinas y carnes, bebidas.
texts.en: Ana is a 42-year old woman, and she has great aspirations in the next few years to make her food sales business a success.  Her history began when it occurred to her to sell snacks on weekends because, since she was cooking for herself, she could make a little extra to sell and earn money for her family.  She works alone, has some difficulties, is single, and has children. Her most important dreams are to have a well-supplied locale, to work every day and to help her family.  Because of this, she would like the loan for her food sales business so she can buy display cases, meats and beverages.

loans.use: to buy display cases, meats, beverages.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia cultivas cafe y platanos,la socia lo vende en forma independiente,la socia lo vende al por mayor por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cafe.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member keeps working on her farm growing coffee and plantains. She sells independently wholesale. With this business she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand the coffee selling business and is asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.  

She is grateful for the opportunity that has been offered in this way and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To pay the laborers who work on her farm

loans.name: Mercedes Herminia

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer de 34 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comidas su historia empezó hace mas de 3 años en la calle con una mesita ahora ya cuento con un local me gusta mucho ser una mujer emprendedora, su trabajo lo hace con una amiga, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener local mas grande. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comidas y asi comprar refrigeradora, cocinas, frutas para mejorar la diversidad de su comida.
texts.en: Mercedes is a 34-year old woman, and she has great aspirations in the next few years to make her food sales business a success.  Her history began more than 3 years ago working along the road with a little table and now she has a location.  She enjoys being an entrepreneurial woman and carries out her work with a friend.  She doesn’t have any difficulties, is single, and has children.  Her most important dream is to have a larger site.  Because of this, she would like the loan for her food sales business and in order to buy a refrigerator, stoves, and fruits to improve the diversity of her food.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, food, fruits.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel Mejia Acosta

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su moto taxi su historia empezó por medio de su padre, su trabajo lo hace con un amigo, tiene dificultades, es soltero, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una casa propia pero se negocio tener un taxi. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su hacerle matenimiento a su moto taxi y comprar algunas herramientas.
texts.en: Carlos is a 29 year old man who really aspires to being prosperous in the next few years with his motorcycle taxi. His story began with his father. He does his job with a friend and has some problems. He is single and has children. His most important dream is to own his own house with his taxi business. That is why he wants the loan, to do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi and buy some tools.

loans.use: to do maintenance on a motorcycle.

loans.name: Patiene

texts.en: Patience, 28, is single and lives at home in Caldwell with her three year old child. For the past two years, she has been selling palm oil, peppers, onions and many other items in the local market. One of the main challenges she faces is that the price of goods can drop after having purchased them at a peak price. Patience is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, peppers, onions, and other items for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, peppers, onions, and many more items for her business.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Introduced to you in the photo above are teachers from a primary school situated in Koidu/Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Like their colleagues from other regions of the country, they have requested a loan of 5,400,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

The leader of this group of teachers is Patrick. Born in Sewafe, in eastern Sierra Leone, the fifty-six year old is married with two children, one of whom is attending primary school. With thirty-five years of experience in the teaching profession, Patrick is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials like cement and sand, for the construction of a family home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and sand, for the construction of a family home.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah, 27, lives in Caldwell and is married with two children, aged 3 and 6. The eldest child is in school and both children live at home. For the past 10 years, Deborah has been selling used clothes, having started her business with her savings. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the near future, Deborah plans to build a shop and to improve the lives of her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en: Seline is 30 years old and a single mother of two children. She keeps poultry and has been in the business for the past 10 years. This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by our client. She will use the loan amount to purchase more chickens for resale in her business. She wants to be the lead poultry farmer in her area.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be jovial, responsible and committed. He operates a grocery store where he sells fruits such as bananas, mangoes, oranges, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place for an area of operation. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for selling. Patrick's dream and business goal is to be a supplier.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is 23 years old and single. He sells secondhand clothes and has been in the business for the past year. This is his first term loan. He was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET LTD staff member. He will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of bed covers, bed sheets and curtains for resale. He hopes to acquire a permanent place where he can operate his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of bed covers, bed sheets and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 27 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is single and has three children between the ages of two and six. For the past six years she has been selling rice, palm oil, charcoal and many other items in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, palm oil, charcoal and other items for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil, charcoal and other items for her business.

loans.name: Monica  B.

texts.en:
Monica is twenty-seven years old and lives in Caldwell along with a child who is aged seven and in school. She is single and is a high-school graduate. 

For the past five years, she has been selling cookies, juice and soft drinks. One of her major problems is that she has to pay a lot of money for transportation and for for the fire to bake the cookies. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase butter, oil, sugar, soft drinks and juice for her business. She plans to own a house one day and to give her child a college education.

loans.use: to purchase butter, oil, sugar, soft drinks and juice for her business.

loans.name: Sararua

texts.en:
Sararua,aged forty-eight, is married and blessed with ten children. He sells livestock which gives him a monthly income of KES 4,500.

This is his first loan term with KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to buy more goats for sale. Sararua hopes to do large-scale livestock keeping and farming in the future.

loans.use: To buy goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is thirty-five years old. He is married to Lilian and together they have three children. He operates a spare parts shop and has been in the business for the past fifteen years.

This is his first term loan in KADET Ltd. He was brought to KADET Ltd by one of our clients. He will use the loan amount to purchase spare parts for sale in his business.

He hopes to own a machinery garage and a car wash in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to sell in his business.

loans.name: Iasha

texts.en:
Iasha is forty-three years old. He lives in a small village in West Georgia with his family: his wife Natia and two sons (aged thirteen and nine). His sons go to school. Iasha leads the agricultural business of the family. They have 0.8 hectares of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown. Iasha sells harvested products on the local open market to greengrocery retailers. Also the family has 22 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Iasha harvests honey twice a year and also sells it on the open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Iasha requested credit to expand the bee-keeping business. He will purchase additional 10 bee-hives and increase the amount of honey he gathers and sells by 45%. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is thirty-one years old. He is from Olkalou, and is married with a son who is ten months old. 

Zablon is a farmer and has been in the farming business for two years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy two bulls to add to his stock.

He hopes to become the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy two bulls to add to his stock.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Francis is the leader of this group of teachers. Francis was born in Koidu. He is fifty years old and married to a teacher. Francis has seven children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. He has been a teacher for thirty-six years. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 31 years old and married with two children who are nine years and one year old. She has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last five years. She was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes for resale. Anne hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is sixty-three years old. He lives in village Kolagi with his wife, sixty-year-old Lena. She is retired and gets a monthly pension of 100 Laris. Lena leads the agricultural business of the family. She has a milk cow and produces cheese, which is sold on local open market. Also Lena takes care of a small pig-farm with two pigs. She sells on average twenty piglets per year. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris, including Lena’s pension.

Yuri is a taxi driver. He provides transportation service to the population of his district. Yuri sold his car, as it was already very old for taxi and requested credit. He will add the money he borrows to the money he got from selling the car and will purchase a better one. He will provide better quality service to clients and attract more customers. The income of the family will increase and Yuri and Lena will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a single man. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail business where he sells swimming costumes and rubber rings. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located near a beach and his primary customers are local residents and tourists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity in the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more swimming costumes and rubber rings. Justus's business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more rubber rings and swimming costumes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David has applied for his fourth loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use it to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings to plant during this planting season. In the future, David hopes to improve his farming methods and plant more commercial crops, hence get more income and improve his family’s business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings to plant during this planting season.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 30 years old, married to Patrick, and they have three children who are in school. Joyce has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her business. She hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Micahel

texts.en: Michael is 24 years old and married to Rebecca. Together they have one child. He operates a posho mill and has been in the business for the past four years. This is his second term loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan to purchase a stock of maize for grinding and then reselling it. He hopes to open a tailoring shop for his wife in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more maize.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia, age 30, is married to Morris and they are blessed with two children, age ten and three years. She runs a retail business that has been in operation for ten years. The business gives her a monthly income of about Kshs 30,000. 

This is her fifth loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy sugar, cereals, rice and cooking oil for resale. Cicilia intends to use the profits anticipated to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cereals, rice and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is forty-six years old. He lives in Sighnaghi District, with his family: his wife – Lali, a twenty-four-year-old daughter and a sixteen-year-old son. David’s son is a pupil and his daughter works as a saleslady in local store. Lali is a housewife. 

David leads the family's farming business. He grows maize and cucumbers on the family's three hectares of land. He sells the corn and cucumbers he harvests on the local open market. David also owns a tractor. He uses it for tilling his land, and also provides seasonal agricultural services to neighborhood farmers, earning additional income. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

David requested credit to purchase fuel for the tractor and fertilizers. He will cultivate the land properly and sow maize and cucumbers. David will work hard during the whole of spring and get a good harvest in the summer, which will be sold for convenient price. David will use his increased income to finance his son's high-school education, which starts next year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel for a tractor to cultivate the land.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is thirty years old and a single mother of three school-aged children. She sells cereals and vegetables and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first term loan in KADET Ltd. She was brought to KADET by one of our clients. She will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of vegetables and cereals for her business.

Her hope is to operate her business in a permanent location.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables and cereals for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty-three years old. She is a single mother of four. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past ten years.
 
This is her first term loan with KADET Ltd. She was brought to KADET by one of our clients. She will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of shoes for resale in her business.

She hopes to expand her shoe business and take it to permanent premises.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of shoes for resale in her business.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is thirty-one years old. He lives in the village of Mukuzani with his family: his wife – Oliko, two sons (five and six years old) and his parents. All of the adult family members are involved in the family's agricultural business. They have one hectare of agricultural land. There is vineyard on 0.7 hectares and strawberries on 0.3 hectares. Gela produces wine and sells it in the village. He sells harvested strawberries on the local open market. They also own a milk cow. Oliko produces cheese and sells it in the village. Along with the above-mentioned the family has twelve sheep and sells lambs during the spring season. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Gela requested credit to purchase calves. He used to have cattle in the past and has a cattle-shed in his yard. He will feed the calves for five to six months and will then sell them in late spring for a higher price. The family will get additional income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is twenty-five years old and lives in Caldwell. She is single and has two children aged two and six, one of whom is in school. Since 2006 she has been running a small restaurant in her community. She sells delicious Liberian dishes. Sometime she has fewer customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, chicken, peppers, onions, fish and oil for her business. She plans to expand her business and further improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase rice, chicken, peppers, onions, fish and oil for her business.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is a forty-seven-year-old farmer from a small village in Sighnaghi District. He is married and lives with his wife – Nina, his twenty-four-year-old daughter and sixteen-year-old son. Jemal’s son goes to school. His daughter works as accountant in a local company. Jemal and Nina are leading the family's agricultural business. They grow cucumbers, eggplants and tomatoes on the family-owned one hectare of land. The family also has a greenhouse, where peppers are grown. Jemal sells the harvested products on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris.

Jemal requested credit to purchase three piglets. He will grow them and sell in fall for a higher price. Part of the credit will be used for cultivation of the agricultural land. The income of the family will increase. Next year, Jemal’s son plans to enter a high-school. Jemal will finance his education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecelia is twenty-eight years old and lives in Caldwell. She is single and has three children, two of whom attend school. For the past five years she has been selling bananas, plantains, cassavas, potatoes and palm nuts in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bananas, plantains, cassavas, potatoes and palm nuts to sell in her business. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, plantains, cassavas, potatoes and palm nuts for her business.

loans.name: Petrica

texts.en: Petrica is twenty-nine years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married and has two children aged three and six. For the past three years, Petricia has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa lives in New Kru town. She is single with a twelve-year-old child who is at school and lives at home. 

For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells soap, tissues, copy books, soft drinks and many other items. She says that at times, business is slow. Theresa says she started this business by selling the few goods she could afford to the community. She learnt this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (soap, tissues, copy books, soft drinks and many other items) for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods including soap, tissues, soft drinks and other items for her business.

loans.name: Grisel

texts.en:
Grisel is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreuners. She came to us because she needs to invest in her business. She is in dentistry and is running her own odontological clinic. It is pretty small still, but she is taking her first steps. After graduating from medical school some years ago, she started working as a dentist in different places and saved money to start her business. 

In the past, Grisel was running a miscellaneous store, for which she took out two loans. After four years she came to us to take an individual loan to improve her odontological clinic by buying some of the dental instruments and materials she needs.

Grisel said her most important challenges were to study and become a professional - and now it is to make her dream come true which is "the one to successful clinic". 

She loves her career and she will give of her best to be as good as she can and serve all the people who come to her clinic. She is single mother with three children and thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy dental instruments and materials.

loans.name: Renchinbaatar

texts.en:
Renchinbaatar is a thirty-six-year-old man who lives with his wife and three kids in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife does sewing from home. Two of their children are in school. 

Renchinbaatar has been running a freight transport business since 2010. He mostly transports freight to rural areas. People hire him because of his experience of driving and knowledge of the roads in the area. He also retails sacks of wood and coal. 

Renchinbaatar is a hardworking and active person who says that "I would like to expand the business by getting sacks of wood and coal in large amounts and I have a further plan to keep this business". The total amount he is requesting is 2,200,000 MNT to purchase sacks of coal and wood to sell.

loans.use: To purchse sacks of coal and wood.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha a 36-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She is engaged in making foods to sell every day in front of her house. Her spouse works as a farmer. They both help each other so that their family will achieve its dream. Editha is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy meat and spices for her grilled meat business.

In the future, Editha hopes that she can see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy meat and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal is forty-nine years old. She is a married woman who is responsible for four children; three are single and one is married. Pal works in the same field of a rubber plantation as her husband and receives a daily wage which is how she makes her living. However, her spouse also is in involved in planting potatoes to make additional income. 

Pal would like to have this loan to buy potatoes in bulk from the local villagers’ plantation. Then she will retail or wholesale them at a reasonable price when the market demand increases. With the income she generates, Pal will save money to buy a plantation where she can grow potato crops as a family-owned business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is 60 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from Kompong Speu province of Cambodia. She is a responsible mother who always takes care of her family's livelihood and provides a good education to her children. Yem has been working in the rice business sector, from which she earns a suitable income for covering her family expenses. 

To upgrade their better quality of life, Yem is requesting her first loan from HKL, which she will use to purchase a motorbike. She says that with the support of her business, it will makes her family live in comfortable way.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 66, lives in Caldwell and is married with two children, ages 32 and 37. Since 2003, she has been selling bread, groundnuts, butter and other items in her community. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, groundnuts, butter and many other items for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, groundnuts, butter, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Elmarie

texts.en: Elmarie is 26 years old and lives in the village of San Antonio.  She is married to Jonel. She has been raising hogs to earn a living for three years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and additional piglets to raise and sell in the future. Elmarie hopes that her business will expand so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
In the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, there are many Cambodian people who prefer agribusiness to other types of business because the path of the Tonle Sap River flows across the province and provides enough water, especially for crops. Among them are Orn, who is 28, and her spouse, who work as local farmers and fish sellers. Every day Orn buys fish in bulk from her frequent suppliers.  Then she transports the fish to sell in a local market and through the commune of the province. She typically earns around US $3.50 per day from this type of business.

In order to sustain and develop her fish selling business, Orn would like to acquire some funds from Kiva partner HKL to purchase fresh fish in bulk.  Then she will make dried fish and fermented fish paste for the future sale. She hopes this loan will be granted to her to develop her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar is twenty-nine years old and lives with his wife and two kids in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His oldest daughter has started to go school and the younger daughter goes to the kindergarden. With his help, his wife has been doing plumbing, construction and house decoration work since 2007. In winter time he also operates a taxi business in the local town. He accepts job proposals from both individuals and offices. 

Over the years, his business services have become well-known and appreciated. Munhbayar is a diligent guy who says that "Now it is getting warm and we would like to expand my business by getting a loan and spending it on the necessary plumbing materials so that we can continue with more capability to earn better so we can feed my family members". 

The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to purchase the plumbing equipment for his construction business.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Naransuren

texts.en:
Naransuren is 52 years old, widowed, and has one daughter who attends school. They live in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. She has been making various types of traditional boots at home. Her production has been improving year by year. Recently, she bought a new sewing machine and other equipment to make the work easier and fast. The customers are always satisfied with the products she is making. 

Naransuren is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase materials to make boots. She is a bright woman with lots of plans for the future. She would like to expand her business by getting the materials in large quantities so that she can have more customers, income, and savings.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make boots.

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
We introduce to you in the photo above teachers of a primary school situated in Koidu/Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Like their colleagues in other regions of the country, they have requested a loan of 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

The leader of this group of teachers is James, who was born in Mafindor, in eastern Sierra Leone. The forty-nine year old is married to a teacher and together they have five children, two of whom are in primary school and three in secondary school. With 23 years of experience in the teaching profession, James is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials such as cement, iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a family home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron, and corrugated zinc, for the construction of a family home.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah, 26, is married with two children, aged two and four. He describes himself as a humble and God fearing man. Isaiah operates a beauty business, providing services such as manicures, pedicures, applying cutex, etc. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are women. He has been in this business for one year and his biggest challenge has been the high price of beauty products. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more beauty products. Isaiah's business goal and dream is to run a spa and a beauty school within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn, 30, has been operating a pig-raising business to generate income in addition to her rice growing business. She built a wooden pigpen at the back of her house and placed around five piglets there. She raises them to sell when they become big enough. As usual, Houn is going to take at least 3-5 months to fatten them. And in this season, she is also preparing her farmland for growing dry-season rice in a new cycle again. She has a common law relationship with her husband who works in rice husbandry. She also has three single children who still need her support.

Houn is taking her third loan from HKL to purchase a pig for breeding purpose. With the remaining funds, she will pay for a rice-farming project. Houn has already paid off her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase a pig for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Huot lives in Kompong Speu province. He has a rice-cultivating business from which he is able to generate a suitable income to support his family. It is his main business and sole source of income. He has a life partner and four children. Three of them are already married and live independently. 

Huot is experiencing difficulties due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle for traveling. That is why he decided to come to HKL to borrow some funds to purchase a motorcycle to improve his living conditions. In the future, Huot hopes to develop his existing business and decorate his house so that it becomes more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Oeu resides in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She earns a livelihood by cultivating rice on her inherited farmland. Oeu has learned this special skill from her ancestors. She works in this business along with her spouse, who is very supportive. Oeu uses earnings from it for her daily expenses, especially for food. She is the mother of two children attending the local school of the province.

With the amount she requested, Oeu would like to buy piglets to fatten for future sale. Oeu’s business goal is to expand her land for her crop-growing business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten for future sale.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia Kanini is a 30-year-old cereals shop owner in Voi, Mombasa. She is the married mother of one. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years. Her business is doing great.

This marks her first loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase maize, beans and cow peas to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and repay her loan. She hopes to see her child well educated and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and cow peas.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed, 54, is married with five children, aged 10 to 20 years. He describes himself as a serious and committed man. He operates a grocery stall where he sells items such as onions, potatoes, cabbages, mangoes, etc. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. Mohamed has been in this business for five years and his biggest challenge has been the high price of fruit and vegetables. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more vegetables and fruit. Mohamed's dream and business goal is to run another grocery shop within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sahr Eric's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Sahr Eric is the leader of this group of teachers. Sahr, 52, was born in the village of Torkpombu in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and together they have three children, two in primary school and the third in college. Sahr has been a teacher for twenty years. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials, such as bags of cement, iron and corrugated zinc, for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bags of cement, iron and corrugated zinc, for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe, 37, is married and has a five year old daughter. She describes herself as jovial, responsible and committed. Kwekwe operates a charcoal sales business, which she has been involved in for seven years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest challenge is the shortage of charcoal due to government restrictions on cutting trees. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more charcoal for resale. Kwekwe's dream and business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is a 45-year-old woman who has been operating a grocery selling business. Her grocery is located in near a market in her community. She has been involved with this business for many years with her humble husband and four children who are still not married and are living under her care. 

From her main job, she can earn about $6 per day for covering her family needs. To upgrade her family's condition, she would like to request some funds from kind lenders. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a new motorbike to improve her present business as well as her everyday life. Her most important dream is to have a very stable, large store with proper doors and well-stocked.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has been patiently managing her variety store. She is 38 years old and married to Emerson. She has been involved in her business for seven years. She and her husband have been blessed with three children. The eldest is in college, the second is in the elementary level and the youngest is still in the infant stage.

Lilibeth has successfully paid back her previous loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. It was used to purchase merchandise. She is really grateful because through her previous loan, she was able to improve her variety store.

Lilibeth would like to access a bigger loan amount of PHP 15,000, which would allow her to buy more groceries for her store. She hopes to obtain the requested loan amount in order to gain more profit to sustain her family needs, most especially her children's education. She believes that her hard work and patience will help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a forty-year-old married man who has six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. Henry has been a retailer for the last five years.  His major challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and taxes. However, he has a goal of buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new areas. Henry needs a loan to buy land for crop growing.

loans.use: to buy land for crop growing.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a 34-year-old cereals shop owner in Mombasa. She is a married mother of two school-going children. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years. Her business is doing great.

This marks her first loan term with KADET  LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase maize, beans, and peas to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to see her children well-educated and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, and peas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a forty-seven-year-old married man with three children.  He lives in Kasese Uganda and has a personal goal of educating his children. Francis has been in the transport sector for over twenty years and his biggest business challenge is the high cost of fuel. He has a goal of owning at least six motorcycles for his transport business. Francis needs a loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en: Abdallah wants a loan to buy an improved water sealing machine. For six years he has been packing water to sell. This forty-eight-year-old hardworking man lives in Masindi, Uganda. He dreams of buying a car and expanding business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy an improved water sealing machine.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, 27, is married to Beatrice and they have one child. He is a carpenter in Naivasha and has a profitable business which enables him to provide for his family.

Godfrey plans to use this loan to buy a water tank for water storage in his home. In the future, Godfrey plans to grow his business, to buy a plot and build commercial and residential houses, and to become one of the best business entrepreneurs in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two sons in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Her older son goes to school and the younger son attends kindergarten  

She has been running a garment and goods retailing business since 2008. She trades them at the central market of the local area. As she is giving birth soon, she is planning to get the supplies in large quantities and sell them. She has a further plan to add another sales channel to increase the sales. 

Tserendolgor is an active woman who says, "I would like to expand my business by getting the supplies in large quantities and earn more for my family and new baby." 

The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase summer garments.

loans.use: To purchase summer garments

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerelmaa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a construction site and all her children are school students. 

She started her food court business in 2010 by renting a place. Her food is known for its taste and value. She recently found a good location and decided to relocate the place. The new location is pretty big so the existing equipment isn't enough for the place. Therefore, she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy necessary products for the new space. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "In the past, my place is so small and very limited. Now that I have a big place, I am sure that I can be successful."

loans.use: To buy necessary products for her new cafe space.

loans.name: Midius

texts.en: Midius wants a loan to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts to sell. She is a 30-year-old single mother living in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. She bought her store from someone after saving enough from her wages when she worked as a shop attendant. Her desire is to educate her children and diversify her business to deal in other general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Munhtur

texts.en:
Munhtur is 30 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his daughter goes to kindergarten. 

He started his retailing business few years ago and is now doing the business with the help of his wife. He sells cigarettes, gum, matches, etc. Even though the profits from each cigarette and piece of gum are small, there are many customers and he feeds the family by the income from the business. 

Munhtur is a smart guy who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by getting the cigarettes in large quantities to sell them wholesale and raise the income for my family."

The total amount he is requesting is 300,000 MNT to get cigarettes for the business.

loans.use: To purchase more cigarettes.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en:
Ochirbat is a man who lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His son is a college student. 

He started making traditional boots in 1997. Since that time, the quality of his products has improved and the number of customers has increased as well. He brings the boots to the big market of the city to sell them. He has been participating in the traditional exhibitions every year. 

Ochirbat is a talented man who says, "I would like to expand the business by getting the materials of the boots such as leather, felt, etc. I have to work hard to feed my family and increase the household." 

The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase the necessary materials.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary materials such as leather and felt.

loans.name: Enan

texts.es:
Enan de 19 años de edad, soltero, vive con sus padres en aldea las Lajas de Taulabe, Comayagua.

Enan tiene su propia fuente de ingresos hace un año se independizo realizando la actividad de reparación de vehículos, ofrece los servicios de mecánica general, enderezado y pintura y soldadura, además vende algunos repuesto y aditivos como aceites, fricciones, silicón etc. desde pequeño empezó a trabajar con su hermano y allí aprendió muy bien este oficio, ahora ya tiene sus propios clientes.
Está solicitando un préstamo de 5,000.00 Lempiras para comprar algunos repuestos y aditivos como fricciones, pastillas de fricción, silicón y aceites, para reparar los vehículos. 
Su meta es ampliar más el local o llegar a tener su propio local ya que actualmente esta alquilando, y con  las ganancias ayudar a su familia y con el estudio a su hermano.
texts.en:
Enan is 29 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in the village of Lajas de Taulabe, Comayagua.  Enan has had his own source of income for one year.  That is when he became independent by doing vehicle repairs.  He provides general mechanic services, bodywork, painting, and soldering.  He also sells replacement parts and additives like oil, brake pads, and lubricant, etc.  When he was young he started to work with his brother, and that is where he learned this trade so well.  Now he has his own customers.

He is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy some replacement parts and additives like fly wheels, brake pads, lubricants, and oil in order to repair vehicles.

His goal is to expand his place more or to come to have his own place as he is now renting.  With the income he helps his family and helps with his brother’s education.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and additives to repair vehicles in his mechanic shop.

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two sons in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. She and her husband have run a transportation service with their own minibus since 2007. Before the business, she used to work in a public transportation company, so she is very experienced in her field. 

Her transportation route is very profitable. However, her minibus is old and rusty so no one wants to sit in her minibus. Therefore, she needs to maintain her minibus. She's requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for her minibus. She's a strong and sharp woman who says, "Now that my son joined a college, I need to increase my income in order to support him."

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer, age 42, is a fish vendor living in Dokuru bor. She has been in her business for four years. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Akeer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 in order to purchase fish to offer for sale. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for to offer for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 24, operates a motorcycle transport business. He has operated his business for three years. He and his wife Nancy have one child. 

This is his first term loan from KADET Ltd. He was brought to KADET Ltd by an existing client. 

He will use the loan amount to repair his motorcycle.

He hopes eventually to purchase another motorcycle, as well as to open a salon for his wife so that they can increase their family income.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Cristhian Xavier

texts.es: Cristhian es un hombre de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio de tricimoto su historia empezó cuando escogió esta actividad ya que trabajaba como dependiente y no ganaba mucho la tricimoto le parece rentable, su trabajo lo hace solo, no tiene dificultades, está casado, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener otra tricimoto. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su servicio de tricimoto.
texts.en: Cristhian is a 29 years old man with a strong desire to improve his “tricimoto” (a three-wheel vehicle) services activity in the next few years. His story began when he chose to engage in this activity, as he had been previously working as an employee but did not earn enough. He thinks the tricimoto is a profitable activity. He works alone and has no problems with it, he is married with children and his main desire is to own another three-wheel vehicle, and he will use the loan he is requesting to invest it in his tricimoto service.

loans.use: To buy tires, a motorbike and motorbike accessories.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 26 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar en su negocio de dar servicios en su tricimoto (este vehiculo lo utilizan mucha gente para poder transportar mercaderia y dirigirse a diferentes partes no tan pobladas). Su historia empezó por medio de su padre lo impulso al negocio, su trabajo lo hace solo, tiene dificultades, es soltero, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una casa propia en su terreno y tener mínimo 3 motos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para poder reparar su tricimoto ya que con las lluvias ha tenido inconvenientes para dar el servicio.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 26-year-old man who has many aspirations for the coming years, most especially prospering in his business of providing services on his moto-trycicle (this vehicle is used by many people to transport merchandise and to travel to different parts that are less populated). 

Carlos' work history began when his father urged him into business. He works alone, has some difficulties, is single, and has no children. His most important dreams are to have his own house on his land and to have a minimum of 3 moto-trycicles.

That's why he desires the loan, to be able to repair his moto-trycicle. With the beginning of rainy season, he has had inconveniences in offering his taxi services.

loans.use: to make repairs on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer in Kitale. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are still schooling. She has been involved in farming for 12 consecutive years and currently produces maize and milk for the local market. 

She is able to support her family's basic needs with this income, although she laments of costly inputs and animal diseases which eat into the farming income. For additional earnings, she also runs a retail shop business in addition to farming.

Esther has requested a loan in the amount of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her milk production and provide the necessary income to provide a good living for her family. She is confident that her family's living standards will improve and that she will be able to ensure the education of her two younger children with the additional income generated from the loan.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gorety

texts.en:
Gorety, age 31, has operated a business in the spare parts industry in Nakuru town for the last five years. She and her husband Julius have a nine-year-old daughter.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy spare parts for her shop.

In future, Gorety hopes to buy a pickup truck which she will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a farmer. She has been engaged in farming for 27 years and manages her farm with the help of one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces horticultural products, maize, and milk. She and her husband have seven children, two of whom are adults. 

Sarah has made a loan request amounting to 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she wants to acquire a better breed of cow to improve her milk production so as to make her family more secure financially and improve the family's living standards.

Sarah says lack of capital remains the main challenge to smallholder farmers' business attempts. She is glad that Juhudi Kilimo loans are focused on making the local farming business better.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maira Arelis

texts.es: María dueña de una pequeña tienda de ropa quien habita en la ciudad de León. Desde hace 6 años se ha dedicado a la venta de mercadería ambulante,  negocio que inicio por medio de sus hermanas mayores que también se dedican a lo mismo. Actualmente se encuentra muy agradecida con MiCredito y Kiva porque con el financiamiento otorgado  compro la mercadería de ropa para damas y caballero que necesitaba vender ha nota mejoras en sus ingresos su negocio va creciendo poco a poco ella siempre  esta con su proyecto de vender camisetas con dibujos  alusivos  a la cultura de Nicaragua sin dejar atrás su meta de poner una tienda grande ropa donde pueda vender al por mayor. Está requiriendo este segundo crédito para comprar zapatos, camisas, pantalones.
texts.en:
Maria is the owner of a small clothing store who lives in the city of León. For the past six years she has worked as a traveling clothes seller, a business she started with the help of her older sisters who are also engaged in this endeavor. 

Currently she is very grateful to MiCredito and Kiva because with the earlier financing provided she bought clothing merchandise for women and men that she needed to sell and has noted that her earnings have improved. Her business has been growing little by little. She is always involved in her project selling t-shirts with drawings related to Nicaraguan culture without leaving behind her goal of establishing a large clothing store where she can sell wholesale. She needs this second loan to purchase shoes, shirts and pants

loans.use: to purchase shoes, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, age 30, is a rice farmer in the Prey Chor District of Kompong Cham Province. Many of the local inhabitants of this area make their living from rice farming. From this career, Sim can provide a good education for her children and cover her family's daily expenses. To assist the family further toward financial stability, her husband, age 32, works hard every day in local construction, allowing him to help support the family’s needs. They have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

In addition to these businesses, the couple is raising seven pigs for additional income at their home. Currently, Sim is seeking a loan from funders for the purpose of purchasing pig feed. 

Sim's dream is to continue moving ahead in life to provide her children with access to further education and to provide for their basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Triza

texts.en: Triza, 27 years old and married to Collins, has been in the food-selling business in Nakuru town for the last two years. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of potatoes and assorted fruits and vegetables for resale to enable her to meet the demand of her customers. In the future,Triza hopes to grow her business and be able to sell and distribute potatoes to other traders in neighboring markets.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes and assorted fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, age 43, is a rice farmer in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. In addition to her farming business, she raises pigs. She has been involved in these businesses for many years. She has gained a good deal of experience from this work, allowing her to expect positive business growth in the coming years. 

Heng's husband also cultivates rice. This humble couple has five children, two of whom are enrolled in school and three of whom are working as factory workers in Phnom Penh city, where they can earn reasonable monthly salaries. 

In order to upgrade the family's living standards, Heng would like to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner with Kiva, for the purpose of purchasing construction supplies, which will allow her to make essential repairs to the family house. Heng hopes eventually to have a house that is more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies, which will allow her to make essential repairs to the family house

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 39 years old. He is married to Wanjiru and together they have three children. He is a shoemaker and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is his first term loan in KADET LTD. He was brought to KADET LTD by one of our clients. He will use the loan amount to purchase thread and leather for making shoes.

He hopes to own a hardware shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase thread and leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian wants a loan to buy beans, maize and groundnuts to sell. She is a 37-year-old married woman living in Masindi-Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her family and her desire is to educate children and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize,  and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Wanjiku

texts.en:
Wanjiku is 58 years old and married to Macharia who is a farmer and they both live in Olkalou. She has been in farming for the last four years. 


She was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our existing customers and she plans to use this amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizers for use during this planting season.

In the future, Wanjiku hopes to buy more farming land and start large-scale farming hence increasing her production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet, aged 29, lives in Masindi-Uganda with her four children. She bought a stationery shop seven years ago which she now operates. She desires to educate her children and move her business to more permanent location. Price fluctuations and high license fees hinder her business. Annet wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ewoi

texts.en:
Ewoi, age 34, runs a grocery business. She has been engaged in this work for the past two years. She and her husband James live in Naivasha and have two children, both of whom are in college.

Ewoi is applying for a loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to add additional stocks of cereals to her inventory.

She hopes to open up a general shop in the near future.

loans.use: to add additional stocks of cereals to her inventory

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina, aged 42, lives in Masindi-Uganda with her four children. Her relatives gave her 300,000 shillings twenty years back to start a business and she ventured into chapati making and selling. She now boasts 1,000,000 UGX as working capital. She desires to educate her children and move her business to a more permanent location. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder her business. Madina intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Elema

texts.en:
Elema wants a loan to pay school fees. For the last seven years, he has been a retailer. This forty-five-year-old hard-working man lives in Masindi-Uganda and  is married with eleven children.

He dreams of  educating his children, buying land and expanding his business into new markets.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph wants a loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi,Uganda. He rides a motorcycle and also operates a salon. He has challenges of high fuel costs and power cut-offs. He dreams of buying a generator and educating his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe tiene 25 años, no es casado pero tiene su pareja con la que tiene 2 hijos pequeños de 3 y 5 años, el se dedica al servicio de albañil que se encuentra viviendo en la localidad de San Luis. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Felipe utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la conclusión de su vivienda, el reto que enfrenta Felipe es terminar su vivienda antes de la época de lluvias para poder habitar en ella,  va a utilizar los beneficios dándole una gran comodidad a su familia, ya que su deseo es poder terminar su casita y así de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Felipe is 25 years old and unmarried, but he has a partner with whom he has 2 little children, ages 3 and 5. Felipe is a bricklayer and lives in the locality of San Luis.

This is his 1st loan through this institution. Felipe will use the loan to buy construction materials to finish building his house. The challenge Felipe faces is to finish his home and move his family in before the rainy season begins. He will use these benefits to provide his family with greater comfort. Felipe's desire is to be able to finish his little house and in this manner, to improve the quality of life for all his family.

Felipe feels happy and grateful for the offer of this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can finish building his home before the rainy season.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La señora Valentina tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su hijo y un nieto ambos dependen de ella, tiene su pequeño negocio de  Pulpería donde vende frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, jabón, leche, huevos, aceite,  pan, refrescos  y otros, sus clientes la prefieren por su buena atención, sale a comprar los productos una vez a la semana al mercado de  la comunidad, su actividad comienza muy temprano en la mañana, todos los días de la semana, los ingresos que obtiene le sirven mucho porque con eso mantiene su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 5,000.00 para poder invertirlo en la compra de variedad de productos para su negocio.
texts.en: Valentina is 49 years old, single, and lives with her son and a grandson, both of whom are dependent on her. She has a small grocery store where she sells beans, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, milk, eggs, oil, bread, soft drinks, and other things. Her customers prefer her because of her attentiveness. She goes out to buy products once a week in the community marketplace. Her work starts very early in the morning, every day of the week. The income she gets serves her well because she supports her family with it . She is asking for a loan in the amount of L. 5,000.00 to be able to invest it in buying a variety of products for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, milk, eggs, bread, oil, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Gilvazias

texts.en:
Gilvazias is a thirty-four-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children, build a permanent house, and buy a car. He has been dealing in produce for the last ten years and his major hardships are price fluctuations and seasonal weather conditions, however, he has a goal of expanding his business to new markets and hiring employees to help expand his business.

Gilvazias needs a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is peacefully living within the village of Turod Norte, Cordon. She has been running her retail store for one year and she has noticed that her average  daily income is increasing. In order for her to maintain her business, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P7,000 which will be used to buy groceries such as cooking ingredients, biscuits, soft drinks and canned goods for her store. She knows that through this financial assistance, she can make her store more profitable, allowing her to provide for her family's needs, most especially the daily school expenses of her two children who go to school.

Evangeline hopes that she can have continued access to financial help from the lenders to be able to send her children into a higher level of education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to be used in buying groceries such as cooking ingredients, biscuits, soft drinks and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah, age 39, is a matatu operator, providing transportation. She has been engaged in this business for the past 13 years. She and her husband Joseph have seven children.

This is her first term loan. She was brought to KADET Ltd by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan amount to repair the seats and tires of her vehicle.

Her hope is to own a chain of buses for transport.

loans.use: to repair the seats and tires of her vehicle

loans.name: Anai

texts.en:
Anai, age 35, sells fish to earn a living. She and her husband live in Dokuru bor with their four children, two of whom are still in school.
 
Anai heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 in order to purchase fish to offer for sale. 

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old, single, and has three children. She is a tailor, which she has been doing for three years.

Susan is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase textile materials for tailoring. She was brought to KADET LTD by a client. She hopes to purchase a plot of land where she can erect a house.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Agot

texts.en:
Agot lives in bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for four years. She is 43 year old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school. 
Agot heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en: Pamellah, a  28-year-old mother of one child, lives in Vihiga  where she has been selling firewood logs for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES. 13,000. Now taking her second loan from KADET LTD. to buy more firewood, her profits will be used to increase her supply of wood for sale. Pamellah's dream is to expand her business and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Abadasigana/nyghnk Group

texts.fr:
Népomuscène fait partie du groupe Abadasigana/Nyghnk. Il a 31 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 1mois à 2 ans. Il a 4 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Népomuscène est agriculteur des tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter le riz, sorgho, arachide pour les revendre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir le projet de l’agriculture des tomates en achetant des champs. Dans les prochaines années, Népomuscène voudrait être professionnel. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Népomuscène is part of the Abadasigana/Nyghn group. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children, one month and two years old. He has four people in his care aside from his children. His education level is four years of primary school.

Népomuscène is a tomato farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy rice, sorghum, and groundnuts to resell.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to enlarge his tomato farming plans by buying some fields. In the coming years, Népomuscène would like to be a professional. With the profits, he foresees educating and taking care of his children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sorghum, and groundnuts to resell.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is 48 years old and has three children. In search of a financing source for his family, he started his own business in animal husbandry in 2005. Zakir joined Aqroinvest to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zakir requested a loan in amount of 1000 AZN to purchase farm supplies and equipment to increase the yield of his land. He is thankful to all of you who will support him at this time.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Eddy Antonio

texts.es:
Eddy, 53 años de edad, originario de San Jacinto una comunidad en las afueras de León, de oficio agricultor, padre de 5 hijos de los cuales todos se dedican ayudarlo en las labores de siembra. Esta actividad la empezó a los 15 años comenzó sembrando maíz y frijol. Hoy en día además de sembrar y vender granos básicos también siembra hortalizas  sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de León en busca de clientes que le paguen un precio justo por sus hortalizas y granos básicos.   
El solicito el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, compra de gasolina para el motor de riego para siembra de chiltomas y cebollas. De las cuales espera sacar una muy buena cosecha que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos y seguir sembrando más áreas del cultivo de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Eddy, 53 years old, was born in San Jacinto, a community on the outskirts of Leon. He is a farmer, the father of 5 children, all of whom are helping with the labor of planting. Eddy began this activity 15 years ago, sowing corn and beans. Today, in addition to planting and selling basic grains, he also grows vegetables. Eddy's products are sold in the city of Leon, where he looks for customers who will pay a just price for his vegetables and basic grains.

Eddy is requesting a loan to buy inputs, fertilizers, and gasoline for his irrigation motor, so that he can plant sweet peppers and onions. He hopes to obtain a good harvest what will enable him to improve his income and continue planting more fields of vegetables.

loans.use: buy spplies, fertilizers, and gasoline for the motor of his irrigation machine, in order to plant sweet peppers and onions.

loans.name: Jamirah

texts.en: Jamirah is thirty four year old hard working lady with three children living in Kasese Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been dealing in phone accessories for the last three years but her major hardship is inadequate capital to meet the demand.  Jamirah has a vision of hiring employees to help expand her business. Jamirah needs a loan to buy phones for resale.

loans.use: to buy phones for resale.

loans.name: Zacheus

texts.en:
Zacheus  is a farmer and the business is doing good. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizers and potato seeds to add to his stock.

Zacheus hopes to see his farming business expand and to enable him to make enough profit which will in turn help improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 26 years old. She is married to Jonathan and together they have two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is her third loan from  KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizerand  potato seedlings for the farm.

Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 50 years old, married, and has children. She works as a local rice cultivator, living in Kompong Cham province.

Chea is requesting her fourth loan from HKL, which she will use to rent a medium-sized plantation to grow potatoes this season. This loan will enable her to further improve her business and increase her income. For the future, Chea wants to buy a few plots of farmland to expand business.

Chea is a very hard-working mother in her responsibilities for the family and in providing her children a good education. She said that she has experienced difficulties because she did not receive an education.  Therefore, she does not want her children to follow her path of life.

loans.use: to rent a medium-sized plantation to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Tuzamurane /ksbgg Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Ksbgg. Il a 27 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 4 ans. Il a 3 personnes dans son charge autre que son enfant. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.

Jean Bosco est agriculteur de tomates et des choux. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir le projet de l’agriculture des tomates en achetant des champs. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être professionnel avec l’agriculture en général. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants et construire sa  propre maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the Tuzamurane/Ksbgg group. He is 27 years old and married, with one child of four years. He has three people in his care other than his child. He education level is five years of secondary school.

Jean Bosco is a tomato and cabbage farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to enlarge his tomato farming undertakings by buying fields. In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to be a professional in farming in general. With the profits, he foresees educating and taking care of his children and building his own home to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.
