Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo, para que su negocio siempre se mantenga estable y se ha decidido a comprar una maquina la cual la utilizara para medir los gramos de oro,tambien comprara prendas como cadenas, aretes, pulseras, de esa forma lograra que sus ventas mejoren cada día.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo, porque lo utilizo en comprar prendas de oro, logro surtir y tener más clientes, sus ingresos mejoraron el cual su familia vive en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan so that her business will always be stable.  She has decided to purchase a machine which she will use to weigh grams of gold.  She will also purchase items such as chains, earrings and bracelets, so that she will have improved sales every day.
Blanca expresses that the previous loan helped her because she used it to purchase gold items and was able to stock up her business and have more customers.  Her income improved, which allowed her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to weigh grams of gold, bracelets and chains.

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Lum is married and lives with her two children in Ntarikon, in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon. Challenges she has faced include the death of her father, minimal education due to her family's lack of funds, and the ill health of her children.

With the loan requested, she will buy beans, maize, groundnuts, garri, groundnut oil, onions and magi cubes. She believes that her business will succeed because of her good location, and her knowledge and experience in the business. She provides her community access to a regular supply of items at affordable prices.

She will use the profit from her business for family medication, children's school fees, food, supporting other relatives and expanding her business. She says that a GHAPE loan is preferable because of its low interest rates, convenient time of payment, and education on loan management.

loans.use: to purchase rice, garri, beans, maize, tomatoes and onion.

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en: Erisa is a 23-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a butchery, that he started last year, where he slaughters goats only. He started with capital worth 500,000 shillings and now the business is worth 1,000,000 shillings. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and high transportation costs. His dream is building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops. Erisa needs the loan to buy goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктору нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы накрыть теплицы, купить уголь, удобрения. К сожалению из-за инфляции и повышения цен своих средств (полученных с предыдущего сезона) не хватает и каждый год в бизнес нужно вкладывать все больше.

В прошлом году Виктор брал кредит на семена высокорослых помидор, так как они очень дорогие. Это полностью оправдало себя. Ранее Виктор получал 50 тыс грн за сезон, а в прошлом году благодаря кредиту его доход составил 78 тыс грн.

Виктор сделал небольшой ремонт в доме, застеклил крыльцо, поставил хорошие пластиковые окна.
texts.en: Viktor needs additional money to cover greenhouses, buy coal and fertilizers.  Unfortunately, due to inflation and increase in prices, he does not have enough of his own means (earned during the previous season) and has to invest more and more into his business every year.  Last year, Viktor obtained a loan for tall tomato plant seeds because they are very expensive.  That investment completely justified itself.  Previously, Viktor earned 50 thousand hryvnia per season, and last year, thanks to the loan, his income was 78 thousand hryvnia.  Viktor also made minor repairs at home.  He covered his front entrance with glass and installed good, plastic windows.

loans.use: to buy plastic, coal for heating, and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, de nuevo solicita un préstamo debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución y para seguir trabajando en la siembra de frijoles y maíz, necesita comprar los insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, abono y semilla, de esa forma lograra tener mejores resultados.
El  menciona que el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien puesto que lo invirtió todo en sus cosechas y logro vender una parte y lo demás para los gastos del hogar el cual le ayudaron mucho a su familia.
texts.en:
José is once again asking for a loan to keep working in the planting of beans and corn because of this institution's great service. He needs to buy agricultural goods like herbicides, fertilizer, and seeds. In this way he can achieve better results.

He says that his last loan was very well spent; he put it all towards his crops and was able to sell some, and the rest he used on household expenses, which helped his family a lot.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Azad Guliyev

texts.ru: Kak vidno na fotografii etot chelovek zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Azad uje 7 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotorix ochen lubit. Azad jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Yemu 38 let. Azad seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. On prodayot moloko i yogurt v magazini Bakinskogo regiona. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimayetsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: As seen on the photograph, this person is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle.  Azad has been involved in this business for seven years.  He is married and has two children, whom he loves very much.  Azad lives in the Baku region together with his friendly family.  He is 38 years old.  Azad needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to develop his business.  He sells milk and yogurt at a store in the Baku region.  He learned this business from his father, who is also involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jinson Vicente

texts.es:
Jinson Vicente tiene 30 años es casado vive con la esposa, y con los hijos Maicol de 6 y david de 3 años.

La ventanilla se llama CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Jesus del Gran Poder, pertenece al canton Ventanas, se dedica a labores agricolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café.
Jinson se dedica a la agricultura a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo y naranja ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en el canton Ventanas y las vende en el mismo lugar.

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea, podas, limpieza del terreno de las malas hiervas y evitar enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Jinson es comprar un terreno, obtener mas productos y mayor produccion.

Le gusta hacer deporte con su familia y amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Jinson Vicente is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children—6 year old Maicol and 3 year old David. 

The group is called Caminando Hacia El Futuro (“Walking Towards the Future.”) It is located in the Jesus del Gran Poder district in the Ventanas canton. It is centered around agricultural labor and the maintenance of the orange, banana, baby orito bananas, cacao and coffee crops. 

Jinson makes a living in agriculture taking care of the coffee, banana, and orange plantations, since these have a longer harvest cycle. He does the purchasing in the Ventanas canton and sells them in the same place. 

He is asking for this loan for the purchase of goods like fertilizer, urea, shears, clearing the land of weeds and getting rid of crop diseases. The loan will help him to increase the quality of the products and avoid losses of crops. His dream is to buy some land, make better products and greater production. 

He likes to play sports with his family and friends from the neighborhood.

loans.use: seeds, goods, fluids, urea and fertilizers

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, de nuevo solicita un préstamo, para seguir con su negocio y aumentar en capital de trabajo y comprar los materiales necesarios como: madera, tabla y pintura, para poder fabricar los muebles para  venderlos.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien pues lo invirtió todo en su negocio y pudo entregar los muebles a tiempo a los clientes, le ayudo porque fueron buenos ingresos los que recibio como pago de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Fredis is once again asking for a loan to keep his business going and to increase his business capital and to buy necessary materials like wood, planks, and paint, to be able to make furniture to sell.

He says that he used the last loan very well, since he put it all towards his business and was able to make the furniture for his customers on time. It helped him because he made a good profit as payment for his work.

loans.use: to purchase wood, planks, and paint.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul used the previous loan to pay for labor, pesticides, and mulch for his plantations. He faces hardships such as price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather changes, and theft; however, he still has a goal of hiring employees to help him expand his business. Paul also has the personal goals of educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying a car. He intends to use the loan to pay workers and to buy pesticides, fertilizers, and mulch.

loans.use: to pay workers and to buy pesticides, fertilizers, and mulch.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 47-year-old single mother of four. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past ten years.

Mary will use the loan amount to purchase poultry feed and pay school fees for her child. She was brought to KADET LTD by another KADET client, and this is her first term loan.

Mary hopes to become the leading farmer from her area.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Luis Gualberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cafe,el vende al por mayor,el socio tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,el socio por medio de estos negocios saca adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de cafe.El socio requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que cultivan cafe. 

El socio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member continues with his business of selling coffee wholesale. He also continues to raise animals. Through these businesses, the member is able to help his family move forward. He dreams of expanding his business of selling coffee. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to pay the workers who grow the coffee.

He is grateful for this opportunity that has been given to him and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay workers who grow coffee.

loans.name: Aphia

texts.en:
Aphia is a 32-year-old married lady with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goals are to educate her children and buy a car.

Aphia has been a retailer for the last eleven years and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Despite these difficulties, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. Aphia needs a loan to buy sodas and sugar for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sodas and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Baptisseurs Plus Group

texts.en:
JP is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Baptisseurs Plus,” which is composed of nine members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

JP, 52 and married, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1994. He operates a general store to the mid-west of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area, and he works hard and uses good management skills to realize his dream of one day opening a drugstore in Kinshasa. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business, which currently earns him $300 per month. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. 

JP is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having ten times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of sugar, and milk and reselling them at a profit. JP has eight children aged between three and 23 years old. Six of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for sale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo quien ya es independiente, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol también presta servicios con un molino de nixtamal, inicia desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su familia para poder tener una fuente de ingresos.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para el pago de la maquinaria para picar zacate, ya que este será el alimento de su ganado, este préstamo le ayudara para poder realizar esta labor que es importante para tener disponible alimento del ganado.
Su aspiración es preparase con este proceso para mantener el ganado alimentado, además de generar mejores ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and son, who is already independent.  He makes a living planting corn and beans. He also offers his services at a mill for corn, which he starts doing at 6 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.  He started this business with the support of his family so that he could have a source of income.  

He is asking for a loan so he can pay for a machine to grind hay, since this will help make food available to his livestock.  His goal is to prepare himself with this process to maintain nourished livestock, and to generate better income for his home.

loans.use: to pay for the machinery to grind hay

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been active in farming for three consecutive years, with her farm producing and selling beans, maize, and milk to the local market. She is married with five children; the oldest is 15 years old and the youngest just five months.

Margaret has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she wants to boost her milk production and improve her milk retail business, which she operates in the local market. Most of the milk she sells currently comes from other farmers, but she believes using her own produce will improve her profits.

Margaret says that drought and animal diseases pose the most significant challenges to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de pollos de engorde, que estén pequeños, tambien les comprara concentrado para alimentarlos y vitaminas, esto le ayudara para mejorar la granja y poder iniciar nuevamente con otra flote de pollos. 
El considera haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, un efecto positivo que le ayudo para hacer más rentable el negocio, están superándose junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan has decided to request a new loan that he will invest in the purchase of young chickens to fatten.  In addition, he will buy feed and vitamins for the chickens.  This will help him to improve his farm, and will allow him to start again with another group of chickens.

He had a good experience with his prior loan; it had a positive effect that helped him to make his business more profitable, and allowed him to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, and vitamins and feed for them

loans.name: El Patuju Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento EL PATUJU esta compuesto de nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones, La presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mercedes,  tiene 49 años de edad no esta casada pero es madre soltera con 3 hijos que ya son independientes, ella se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de San Juan. Este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Mercedes              utilizara  este préstamo  para la Compra de mesas y sillas plásticas para  implementar en su puesto de venta ya que se incremento su clientela y ella quiere brindarles mayor comodidad. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Hacer crecer el negocio. Mercedes enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  La competencia del mercado y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank EL PATUJU is composed of 9 members: 7 women and two men.  The president of the bank is Mercedes.  She is 49 years old and is not married but she is a single mother of 3 children who are already living independently.  She makes a living in the preparation and sale of food at her stall that is located in the area of San Juan.  

This loan is her first within the organization.  Mercedes will use this loan for the purchase of tables and plastic chairs, which she will use in her stall, since her customers have increased and she would like to make them more comfortable.  Her reason for asking for this loan is to grow the business.  

Mercedes has come up against challenges to her business in the form of competition and she will use the benefits to improve her quality of live.  She is very happy and grateful to the organization for the support it has offered her.

loans.use: to buy tables and plastic chairs

loans.name: Bih Regina

texts.en:
Bih Regina is married with six children. She and her family live in the Musang quarter of the Mezam division in the Northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, including inadequate capital hindering her business, the death of her brother, and sicknesses.

With the money from the requested loan, Bih Regina plans to buy a motorbike. The bike will be used to start an affordable transportation business for community members, carrying farmers to work and students to school, as well as transporting items like produce and firewood for sale. She thinks her business will succeed because she has good management skills and because she has been in business for a long time and not encountered any insurmountable problems. 

Bih Regina says she will use the profit from the loan to educate her younger children, cater to family needs, and to arrange traveling documents for one of her children to go abroad in search of greener pastures. She says a GHAPE loan is preferable because loans are given without collateral securities, the disbursement process is not complicated, and an installment repayment plan is available.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 50 years old, and he and his wife Margaret have three children. He is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past ten years.

This is Paul's first loan, and he was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan amount to put up a shelter for his poultry and purchase chicken feed.

Paul hopes to become the leading farmer from his area.

loans.use: to put up a shelter and purchase feed for his poultry.

loans.name: Adalberto Enrique

texts.es:
Adalberto, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que su negocio se encuentra estable, el quiere invertir en la compra de resina para fabricar fibra de vidrio, esto le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y mantenerse atento a la demanda.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar y esto le ha servido para superarse junto a la familia.
texts.en:
Adalberto is requesting a new loan because his business is stable.  He wants to invest in the purchase of resin so that he can make fiberglass.  This will help him to strengthen his business and stay on top of the demand.

He thinks that his previous loan helped him to improve his business, and this has allowed him to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to purchase resin

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 and married with four children; the youngest two are still in school. Margaret has been in farming for eight years, producing and selling milk, maize, and horticultural products.

Margaret has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her milk production and income to meet family needs. She is also focusing on constructing a zero grazing unit and increasing the number of dairy cows on her farm.

Margaret laments the high costs of dealing with challenges like dairy diseases and unreliable rains.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que está iniciando el proceso de una nueva siembra, con el dinero de este préstamo podrá pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultivara el maíz y los frijoles, con ello seguirá realizando el trabajo que con mucho gusto desempeña.
Él considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo con la utilización del préstamo anterior, ya que obtuvo los insumos necesarios y pudo recoger la colecta de maíz y frijol, esto le contrajo beneficios a su familia, ya que mantienen los granos básicos para la alimentación.
texts.en:
Yonis is requesting a new loan because he is in the process of planting a new crop. With the money from this loan he will be able to pay for the lease on the land where he grows corn and beans. This will allow him to continue doing the work which he enjoys. 

He believes the way that he used the previous loan had a positive effect. He was able to buy the necessary supplies and was able to harvest the corn and beans. This benefited his family because as a result they were able to maintain their supply of basic grains to eat.

loans.use: to pay to lease land.

loans.name: Ever Omar

texts.es:
Ever, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, porque está reparando el techo de la vivienda, para eso comprara Duralita, cemento, arena, hierro, pago de mano de obra.
Este nuevo préstamo le ayudara para poder realizar los cambios en la vivienda, haciéndola más confortable, él considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, porque finalizo la construcción  y reparacion de paredes, viviendo en mejores condiciones a través de esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Ever is requesting a new loan to use to buy construction materials. He will use them to repair the roof on his home. The supplies he will buy include sheet metal, cement, sand and rod iron and he will also pay for labor. 

This new loan will help him to be able to complete the changes to his home, making it more comfortable. He feels that he had a good experience with his previous loan, because he finished the construction and repairs on the walls. As a result of the previous support he has improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, cement, sand and rod iron and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Abatiganda/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Sylvain  fait partie du groupe Abatiganda/Crkr. Il a 33 ans et il est marié, avec 6 enfants de 3 mois à 12 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Sylvain est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Sylvain voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvain is a member of the Abatiganda/Crkr group.  He is 33 years old and married with six children ranging in age from three months to twelve years.   He attended school through the sixth year of primary school.
Sylvain is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and pay his labor. 
His strategy to grow his business is to use improved seeds.  In the years to come he would like to be an important farmer in his region. With his profits, he plans to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay his labor.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single 34-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Kongowea, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last seven years, and she is doing great.
 
This is Sophia's first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more bananas, mangoes, and cabbages to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and add more stock to her business. She hopes to continue to excel at her work.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, mangoes, and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Manuelita Beatriz

texts.es: Manuelita es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 31 años de edad. En un municipio a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  se dedica a la venta de comidas en especial sopas,  un caldo nutritivo con substancia y sabor  que lleva ingredientes sólidos como  vegetales o productos cárnicos;   Ella es muy conocida entre sus vecinos de barrio por la gustosa fabricación de este alimento. Así mismo también vende aunque en menor cantidad almuerzos completos y fritos. En su negocio tiene 6 años de estar trabajando y con ello y ayuda en los gastos de su hogar. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad, lo que le  permite aportar a los gastos del hogar, tiene pocos activos fijos, pero entre sus metas mas adelante está   organizar su negocio en un local y tener allí toda la infraestructura de un restaurante. Su rentabilidad tiene un alto margen, su cartera rota  aproximadamente semanal y sus compras las realiza en pequeños volúmenes por lo cual usualmente no gana descuentos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  víveres, verduras y carnes en mayor cantidad, para lograr descuentos, también invertirá en algunos enseres para servir las comidas y ofrecer un servicio de una mayor excelencia.
texts.en:
Manuelita is married with 3 children between the ages of 14 and 31 years old. In a municipality 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla she makes a living selling food. Her specialty is soup; the soup is nutritious, filling and flavorful and has solid ingredients like vegetables and meat. She is well known amongst her neighbors for the joyful way in which she prepares her food. She also serves in small quantities lunch plates. 

She has had her business for six years. It has allowed her to help with household expenses. Her monthly sales generate a good profit margin. which allows her to contribute to household expenses. She has limited assets, but one of her goals for the future is to set up her business in a commercial space and have a more formal restaurant. 

She has a high profit margin, her menu changes weekly and she makes purchases in small quantities which does not allow her to take advantage of discounts. This is the reason she has requested a loan through Kiva. It will be the first loan she has received through the 'Fundación Mario Santo Domingo'. With the loan she will buy groceries, vegetables and meat in large quantities, allowing her to buy at discounted prices. She is also going to invest in some dishes to serve the food on. This will allow her to offer service of higher excellence.

loans.use: to buy groceries, vegetables and meat in large volume and to invest in dishes to serve the food on.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Rokhi, West Georgia with his wife, Lali, his 22 year old son and 20 year old daughter. Rezo’s daughter is a student, and his son helps the parents in the family agricultural business. 

Rezo and Lali are leading the agricultural business of the family. They have three milk cows and three calves. Lali produces cheese and sells on average 60 kg. of this product on the local open market. Also, the family owns 1.2 hectares of land. On one part of the land vines are grown. Rezo sells harvested grapes on the local open market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Rezo requested credit for financing spring seasonal agricultural works. In particular, he will cultivate the second part of family-owned land and purchase fertilizers, as well as pesticides. Rezo will cultivate the land and sow melon and watermelon on it. The family will sell harvested fruits on the local open market in the summer. They will get additional income, which will be used for financing the daughter’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to rent a tractor for tilling the land.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 26 years old, and he and his wife Naomi are blessed with one child. Paul operates a motorcycle transport business and also sells electronics accessories; these activities earn him a monthly income of 36,000 KES.

This is Paul's first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy electronics accessories. Paul intends to use the anticipated profits to buy another motorbike in the future.

loans.use: to buy electronics accessories.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is aged 49 and has been in farming in his rural home of Kitale, Western Kenya where he lives with his wife and three children. His children are aged between 22 and 16 years. His younger two children are still schooling. He has been active in farming for 3 years with his major product being maize, while milk and horticultural products being the other products.

Evans has requested a loan of 81,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200KES to boost his dairy farming. He will use the rest of the loan (50,000 KES ) to venture into poultry farming. He says it is the farming business that helps him to meet his family needs, especially the education of the children and the family's daily meals.

He laments of high costs of feeds and other farm inputs, coupled with serious fluctuations in market prices.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow and to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. All of her children are still in school. 

Stella heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: David Makhareishvili

texts.en:
David is 45 years old. He lives in the village of Pereta, West Georgia. David lives with his family: wife – Iza and three children (20, 18 and 14 years old). His younger children go to school and the elder one helps his father in construction works. 

David is a construction worker. He mainly works on roofing houses. His elder son helps him. Along with his main job, David is busy with a family agriculture business. In particular the family owns a greenhouse, where greens and vegetables are grown. He sells harvested vegetables locally to greengrocery products retailers. Also, the family has a plot of land where nut and peach trees grow. David sells harvested nuts and peaches on the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

David has requested credit for fixing the greenhouse. He will change the plastic covering and will get a better harvest as the greenhouse (with new plastic cover) will keep the needed temperature and produce a better harvest. This harvest, in turn, can be sold for a higher price. The income of the family will increase. Also, with a small part of the credit David plans to renovate one room in their house in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene covers to fix the greenhouse and materials for renovation of one room of the house.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter has been farming for five years in his hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya, where he also lives with his family. His farm produces maize, vegetables, and watermelons, which he sells at the local market. In addition to farming, Walter runs a motorcycle transport business.

Walter has made a loan request from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 60,000 KES to buy poultry. He is hopeful that he will be able to grow his poultry business and venture into dairy farming as well. He adds that the proceeds from his farm are mostly spent educating his children.

This is Walter's fifth loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their efficiency in loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo porque está iniciando el cultivo de maíz, para esto necesita alquilar el terreno donde realizara dicha siembra, el dinero de este préstamo será utilizado en el arrendamiento del terreno, ayudándole a tener la seguridad para continuar sembrando.
Él considera que a través del préstamo anterior pudo adquirir los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos a la siembra, de la cual obtuvo buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Denis has decided to ask for another loan because he is starting to grow corn. For this he needs to rent some land where he can grow the crop.The money from this loan will be used to rent the land, helping him to have the security to keep growing.  

He considers that with the previous loan he was able to acquire the materials he needed to apply to the crop, and with this he obtained a good crop.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Juntos Trabajando Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Rufino, tiene 49 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. El forma parte del grupo "Juntos Trabajando", integrado por 5 socios residentes de la zona de San Jua  Bautista en el distrito de Comas, sus compañeros lo eligieron como Tesorero del grupo por la confianza que se ha ganado entre ellos demostrando su honradez.
El Sr. Rufino se dedica desde hace 20 años a prestar servicio de transporte mediante una mototaxi, gracias a su trabajo ha podido mantener a su familia, construri su casa y dar estudios a sus hijos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi para poder brindar un buen servicio a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Rufino is 49 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He is part of the group 'Juntos Trabajando' [Working Together], which is made up of 5 members who are residents of the area of San Jua Bautista in the district of Comas. He was selected by his fellow group members to be treasurer of the group for the trust he has gained in the group by the honesty he demonstrates. 

For the past 20 years Rufino has made a living providing transportation by moto-taxi. Thanks to his work he has been able to support his family, build a house and pay to educate his children. 

The loan he will receive will be invested in maintenance for his moto-taxi, which will allow him to provide good service to his passengers.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Timoteo Aparicio

texts.es:
Timoteo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para el pago del alquiler de terreno, porque está iniciando la siembra y desea tener seguro el lugar donde realizar el cultivo.
Él considera que a través de estos préstamos los agricultores realizan mejor su trabajo, porque su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue muy favorable ya que logro obtener buenas cosechas con los insumos que aplico. Este es su segundo prestamo.
texts.en:
Timoteo is asking for a new loan to pay for renting land because he is staring to plant and he needs to secure a place to to grow the crop. 

He considers that with these loans farmers can do their job better. His prior experience with the loan was very favorable since he was able to get good crops with the materials he applied. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Jeremie

texts.en:
Jeremie is married with six children aged between 18 and 30. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for five years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more out put.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans as of 2009. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and seeds, and to pay for support labor.

loans.name: William Gicheru

texts.en:
William, aged 44, is married to Caroline. They are blessed with two children. He runs a retail shop and has been doing this for one year. The monthly income from the business is KES 20,000.

This is William's first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour to sell. William hopes to open another outlet in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour to sell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for four years. She is a 40 year old married woman who has four children, all of them still in school. 

Vicky heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa, trabaja como maestra en una unidad educativa en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar la tesis de su hija, ya que con esto le ayudara  a graduarse y a tener mejores ingresos.
Eloisa, es casada y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de su hermano en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de  la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la sexta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eloisa works as a teacher at an educational center in the city of La Paz. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay the cost of her daughter's thesis, which she needs to graduate so that she can earn more income. Eloisa is married and has three children who live with her. They live at her brother's house in the District of Ciudadela Ferroviaria in the city of La Paz.

This is the sixth time she has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of her daughter's thesis.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina lives in Kator. She sells clothes, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Both of them are still in school. 

Natalina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de un pedido de lámparas, para surtir el negocio, esta compra le ayudara para atender mejor la demanda de los clientes.
El considera que a través de estos préstamos ha logrado mejorar la condición del negocio, así tambien le permitió tener una mejor atención  a los clientes,  todo esto le ha beneficiado a su familia, para tener una condicion más estable.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a new loan in order to pay for an order of flashlights to restock his business. This purchase will help him better meet the demand from his customers. He says that the loans enabled him to improve the condition of his business. They have also allowed him to provide better service to his customers.

All of these results have benefited his family and provided them more stable conditions.

loans.use: to pay for an order of flashlights.

loans.name: Duo Noveno San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Duo Noveno San Pedro. Doña Maria del Carmen, de 22 años tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de calzado y cosmeticos desde hace 3 años nos cuenta que lucha por una vida mejor cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo inicio su negocio pues por la misma nececidad de que su esposo trabaja pero lo que gana no le alcanza gracias a Dios que le dio la oportunidad de este negocio, le a serbido para darle lo nesesario a su hija,el producto que ella vende los ofrece en las fabricas donde laboran muchas personas gracias a Dios lo que vende no le alcanza porque las personas le compra mucho y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en calzado y cosmeticos.espra que Kiva le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitando.,
al igual que la siguiente socia se dedica a la venta de productos basicos y cosmeticos.
texts.en:
Duo Noveno San Pedro. 

Doña Maria del Carmen is 22 years old and has two children. For the past three years, she has made a living by selling shoes and cosmetics. She tells us that she struggles for a better life and she relies on her husband's help. He works, but the money he earns is not enough. So, she started her business due to this necessity. Thanks to God, she received this business opportunity, which has allowed her to provide for her daughter. 

She offers the product she sells in factories where many people work. She does not have enough of what she sells because the people buy a lot and she has a large demand from her customers. For this reason, she is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise of shoes and cosmetics. She hopes that Kiva can help her with the loan she is requesting, as well as the other member who makes a living by selling basic products and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy shoes and cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old and has been in farming for five years, producing milk and eggs which she sells to the local market. She is married with five children between the ages of eight and 22 years. The youngest four are still in school.

Mary has requested a loan of 102,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her boost her farming. She says she will buy a dairy cow at 52,000 KES and put up a greenhouse where she can grow tomatoes. This is her second loan after the first one of 50,000 KES.  She pursues active farming with a loan from Juhudi Kilimo and remains optimistic that business will continue to improve.

Mary sees the major challenge to be animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow and build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel, vive con su esposa, él administra una tienda de productos domésticos, su esposa le ayuda a tender a los clientes, esta tienda está ubicada en su casa de habitación, existe desde hace tres años, su horario es de 6:00am a 8:00pm.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, como jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, galletas, dulces, embutidos, huevos, pastas, y más, que son productos que a diario lo demandan sus clientes, este préstamo le ayudara  a Fidel a tener la disponibilidad para mejorar el negocio.
La aspiración de él con este préstamo es realizar una buena inversión, de la cual pueda obtener ganancias y poder pagar las cuotas de este préstamo y tener mayor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Fidel lives with his wife and manages a store that sells house-hold products.  His wife helps him tend to the customers.  The store is located out of his home and has existed for the last three years. The hours are 6:00 am to 8:00 pm.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock his business such as juices, carbonated drinks, snacks, cookies, sweets, sausages, eggs, pasta, and more. These are the products that his customers request everyday, and this loan will help Fidel have them available in order to better his business.  

With this loan he hopes to make a good investment which will make him profitable.  He also wants to be able to pay the installments for this loan and have greater financial competence.

loans.use: to purchase juice, carbonated drinks, snacks, cookies, sweets, and sausages.

loans.name: 74-Las Positivas Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento las 74 – POSITIVAS esta compuesta por diez integrantes de los cuales ocho son mujeres y 2 varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Blanca ella vive en la zona de Bendek,  se dedica  al venta de anticuchos que son un acomida muy tradicional de Bolivia que son como las brochetas, que esta elaborado con menudencias de la vaca y con papa,  la solicitante vive en casa familiar,  la venta de anticuchos la viene desarrollando desde hace tres años, teniendo buenos ingresos por ventas, la solicitante esta ampliando su negocio y así tener mayor venta.  Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de insumos como papa, maní, carnes para la elaboración de sus anticuchos,  La solicitante agradeció a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y al mismo tiempo agradeció por la rapidez con la que se la atendió, ya que le permite mejorar en sus actividad económica y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "74-Positivas" is made up of ten people, 8 women and 2 men.  They make their livings in different businesses.  The president of the bank is Mrs. Blanca.  She lives in the Bendek neighborhood and works selling "anticuchos", [a very traditional Bolivian food similar to kebabs, prepared with cow giblets and potatoes].  

The borrower lives in a family home and she has been developing the sale of "anticuchos" for three years.  She has had good earnings from the sales and she is expanding her business to have even greater sales.  She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as potatoes, peanuts, and meats for the preparation of "anticuchos".  

The borrower appreciates this institution for the opportunity given to her and at the same time appreciates how quickly she was assisted.  This loan allows her to improve her business and thus improve the quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to purchase products such as potatoes, meat, and peanuts for the preparation of "anticuchos" [Bolivian-style kebabs].

loans.name: Boblawende Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARGUERITE est la représentante du groupe BOBLAWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans le moins âgé a 08mois. 02  vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est couturière. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 1996 (16ans). Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Toecin et au marché de signoghin. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 rouleau de popeline ; 01 paquet de fermeture double col et du satin.

Elle  épargne  un peu ses bénéfices et participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une machine à broder pour son activité.
texts.en:
Mme Marguerite is the leader of the Boblawende group. She is married and has 4 children, aged between 11 and 8 months. Two of the children go to school, and she is responsible for 4 people.

Marguerite has been a seamstress since 1996 (16 years). She obtains her supplies at the markets in Toecin and Signoghin. Her customers are both men and women. She would like to buy 1 roll of poplin, 1 packet of of double collar zippers, and satin. 

Marguerite saves some of her profits, and helps improve her family's living conditions. Her goal is to buy an embroidery machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy 1 roll of poplin, 1 packet of double collar zippers, and satin.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana, quiere seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en el negocio, por esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para ser invertido en insumos para la comida como aceite, condimentos, carnes, vegetales, gaseosas, entre otros productos que son muy necesarios para la elaboración de los menús.
Ella considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo en el negocio, con el primer préstamo, ha ido evolucionando favorablemente, las condiciones en su familia son mejores ya que tiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana would like to continue working and developing her business. This is why she is asking for a new loan, which she will use to buy supplies for her prepared food business, such as oil, condiments, meats, vegetables, sodas, and the other products needed to make her food. Ana believes that her business is going well. The first loan had good results. Her family is doing better and she has better earnings.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, meats, vegetables and sodas.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es una mujer de 58 años, que vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar que en el transcurso de estos últimos 3 años ha afrontado un cambio positivo en el aspecto del desarrollo económico debido al ingreso de nuevas tiendas comerciales, los mismos que han generado innumerables puestos de trabajo estables y bajo la normativa de las leyes vigentes. 

Actualmente Maria se dedica a la venta de comida – Menús y bebidas, ella atiende a un promedio de 12 comensales diariamente, en un promedio de 8 horas diarias, tiempo en el que hace las compras de los insumos, la preparación de los alimentos y desde luego la atención a sus clientes.

María nos comenta que sus clientes están muy contentos con el sabor de la comida que vende y como muestra de ello continuamente están recomendándola con familiares o amigos. María está muy agradecida con su madre ya que gracias a ella se animó a poner este tipo de negocio y también le agradece que le haya enseñado sobre la preparación de los alimentos.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Maria podrá realizar la compra de algunas cajas de bebidas para ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes y también desea arreglar la fachada de su mini restaurante. Maria piensa en ahorrar el dinero necesario para agrandar su mini restaurante y así generarse a sí misma una mejor oportunidad de negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a 58 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica, a place where the passage of these last three years has brought about a positive change in the sense of economic development, thanks to the influx of new commercial stores, which have also generated innumerable stable, vigilantly supervised jobs. 

Right now Maria makes a living selling food—meals and drinks. She attends to an average of 12 guests a day in an average of 8 hours a day, during which she purchases the goods, prepares the ingredients, and of course gives her attention to her customers.

Maria tells us that her customers are very happy with the taste of the food she sells and how they show it continually by recommending her to friends and family. Maria is very grateful to her mother, since thanks to her she was motivated to do this type of job, and she is also grateful to her for what she has taught her about food preparation.

With the help of Kiva loans, Maria will be able to purchase a few boxes of drinks so that she can offer the most variety to her customers, and she also wants to fix up the front of her small restaurant. Maria is thinking about saving up the money she needs to expand her small restaurant, and in doing so give herself greater business opportunities.

loans.use: purchase boxes of drinks and fix up the front of her small restaurant.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es: Jorge, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de repuestos electrónicos para el taller, ya que tener disponibilidad le permite realizar las reparaciones que demanden los clientes, él a través de estos préstamos ha logrado mantener la preferencia en el lugar y seguir generando ganancias para su familia, quienes ahora gozan de una mejor situación económica.
texts.en: George is asking for this new loan in order to buy electronic parts for his workshop. He would like to have the needed items in order to make the repairs requested by his customers. With the use of his loans, he is able to maintain a popular business in his neighborhood. He can continue generating income for his family, who now are enjoying a better economic situatiion.

loans.use: to buy parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Bertha Jannet

texts.es: La Srta. Bertha es casada, tiene 25  años de edad, Bertha estudia educación inicial en una Universidad Estatal, Bertha escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente, actualmente trabaja como profesora de educación inicial, Su sueño de Bertha es con el tiempo poner un colegio, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar curso de capacitacion de Docente, Bertha cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Miss Bertha is married and twenty five years old. Bertha studied primary education at the State University. Bertha chose this career as it is her vocation and she has the capacity and ability to develop professionally. She is now working as a primary school teacher. Her dream is to start her own school. This is why she is asking for this new loan in order to continue her professonal education. Bertha will reach her goals with hardwork and effort. The loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to pay for her professional teacher education.

loans.name: Blanca Dayssi

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando un préstamo para fortalecer el inventario del negocio, utilizando estos fondos para la compra de más medicamentos variados para distintas enfermedades y además vitaminas para fortalecer tanto la sangre como el sistema nervioso y cerebral de las personas, esto le ayudara para surtir y mejorar la atención a las diferentes necesidades de los clientes.
Ella considera que  ha mejorado y esta superándose a través de este servicio de créditos, porque tiene más facilidad para comprar y pagar las cuotas, tambien nos comenta que su familia está estable.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting this loan in order to buy inventory for her business. She will use these funds to buy a larger variety of medicines for particular illnesses. She will also buy vitamins that can enhance the blood, thereby improving the individual’s nervous system and brain. This loan will be used to provide a greater variety of products and give the customers alternatives for their needs.
Blanca thinks that she has improved and gotten better because of the services of these loans. She can buy supplies and pay her bills more easily. She also says that her family situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy medicine in order to sell it.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque desea iniciar con su labor agrícola, sembrando nuevamente maíz y pipián, este préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de abono y herbicidas, los cuales utiliza para fortalecer la plantación así como para prevenirla de plagas.
La experiencia de José con el préstamo anterior fue muy buena, recibiendo buenas cosechas para poder sustentar la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting this new loan in order to begin a new planting cycle, planting corn and pumpkins. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer and herbicides, which will help to establish his plants and fight off diseases. 
Jose had a good experience with his last loan. He had a good harvest and was able to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque se encuentra trabajando el terreno donde iniciara su próximo cultivo, él necesita comprarse abono, herbicidas, semilla, y preparación del terreno, en esto será utilizado el crédito, esperando que sea una buena experiencia al igual que su préstamo anterior, con el cual logro tener una buena cosecha de maíz, pipián, plátanos, que son los productos que nuevamente sembrara.
texts.en: Marcos is asking for this new loan because he wants to continue working his land by planting new crops. He needs to buy manure, herbicides and seeds and he needs to prepare the land. This is how he will use his loan. He hopes that this will be as good of an experience as his last loan. With the help of the last loan he had a good harvest of corn, pumpkins and plantains, which are the crops he is going to grow again.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Hever Anthonyn

texts.es:
Hever, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que son un gran apoyo para él, porque realiza el negocio a través de las inversiones de los financiamientos, la utilización de este nuevo préstamo será en la compra de pan ya elaborado en variedad, para tener surtido el negocio y mejorar las ventas.
Él considera que a través del préstamo anterior, logro estabilizar el negocio, las ventas y las ganancias, alcanzando una mejor solvencia económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Hever is asking for a new loan because he believes they are a great help to him because he does business through financial investments. The use of this new loan will be to purchase various types of bread in order to stock his business and improve sales. 

He believes that through the last loan he was able to establish the business, sales, and earnings, achieving better economic solvency for his family.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con tres hijos, de 19, 16 y 13 años de edad y su esposa, uno de ellos es independientes, él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos,hortalizas, dulce de atado y a la ganadería, el inicio este trabajo desde joven, inicia desde las 5:00am hasta las 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el pago de mano de obra para procesarlo 8 hectáreas de caña de azúcar y hacer el dulce de atado, este préstamo le ayudara para poder realizar la molienda de la cual vende los productos generando sus ganancias.
La aspiración de Víctor es iniciar una buena relación con la institución para seguir trabajando y de esta manera desarrollar sus actividades con el aporte de los préstamos.
texts.en: Victor lives with his three children, ages 19, 16 and 13, and his wife. One of his children lives independently. Victor grows grain, vegetables and sugar cane and also raises cattle. He has been doing this work since he was young. He begins work at 5am and works until 4pm. Actually he is asking for this loan in order to pay workers to pick 8 hectacres of sugar cane and process the cane. This loan will help him process his sugar cane which he can then sell and generate income. Victor hopes to start a good relationship with this institution so that he can continue working. In this manner he can develop his activities in order to support his loans.

loans.use: to pay for workers to process his sugar cane.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is married with two children between the ages of two and four.  They are enrolled in school.  His wife works as a farmer.  He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and hire support labor.  This will help him get the best harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to create more output and make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire extra labor.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosario Vilma, tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y forma parte del grupo "Mujeres unidas por siempre" formado por siete integrantes, vecinas, residentes dela zona de Tahuantinsuyo en el distrito de Independencia, sus compañeras la eligieron como la tesorera del grupo basados en los valores que demuestra la Sra. Rosario Vilma.
Desde hace mas de 20 años ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inició éste negocio debido a la pérdida de su padre, ella se vió obligada a buscarse una fuente de ingreso para poder sustentar sus gastos y sobretodo poder lograr su meta la cual era ser una profesional. Con su trabajo ella pudo mantenerse económicamente y sobretodo pagar sus estudios universitarios, también pudo invertir un poco de capital en un negocio familiar basado en la venta de papel de regalo por mayor.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para aumentar su stock y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosario Vilma is 47 years old and single. She is part of the group “Mujeres unidas por siempre" (Women United Forever) which is made up of 7 members who are neighbors and residents of the Tahuantinsuyo area, in the district of Independencia. Her partners elected her as treasurer of the group because of the virtues she demonstrates. 

She has sold beauty products for more than 20 years. She began this business because of the death of her father. She found herself needing to find a better way to earn money to pay her bills and, above all, to be able to reach her goal which was to be a professional. With her work she was able to keep up financially and pay for her university studies. She was also able to invest a little capital into a family business selling gift paper in bulk. 

She will invest the requested loan into the purchase of beauty products to increase her stock and offer a better variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in order to increase her stock.

loans.name: Doki

texts.en: Doki lives in Kator. She sells bread and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married and has six children – five of them are still in school. Doki heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase bread. She will use her extra income to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 55, is a widowed mother of one.  Her child is 16 years old.  She has been dairy farming for 16 years.  Her monthly income from the business is KES 39,000.

This is her sixth loan from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history.  She will use the funds to buy two more dairy cows.  Jane hopes to open a milk depot in the future.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, age 65, is a widowed mother of four children. She sells groceries and has been doing this for five years. Her monthly income from the business is 3,000 Kenyan shillings. This is her first loan term with KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. Susan hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 31 years old from Naivasha and is married to Julius and they have two sons who are between the age of 10 and 8 years old.

Gladys has been operating a retail shop for the past 10 years. She has applied for a loan from KADET LTD  to enable her buy more eggs, sugar, milk etc to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business and also build residential houses for rental.

loans.use: To buy  more  stock of eggs, sugar and milk  for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married with three children between 9 and 21 years old.  All three are enrolled in school.  His wife works as a farmer.  He has been a rice farmer for eight years.  He would like this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to hire support labor to get the best harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and build another house.  In the picture, there are other agriculture borrowers behind him reading the Kiva forms.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and labor.

loans.name: Ladislas

texts.en:
Ladislas is married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 25. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profit, he plans to expand the area he farms to get more output, to pay school fees and to build a house with the balance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children. Two of them are still in school. 
Roda heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is married with one child who is 12 years old. Her husband works as a tax collector. She has been a rice farmer for 1 year. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output and build savings. In the picture, the borrowers lined for the photos after filling the Kiva forms in their hands.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santo Tomas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ángela de 30 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa en especial de niños, niñas y adolescentes. Ella inicio este negocio junto con su suegra la cual viaja y manda la mercadería, esto logro por los créditos ya que antes pedían la mercadería.
Esta madre de tres niños de 10, 6 y 4 años tiene la meta lograr tener una tienda.
Las otras integrantes son María Carlota quien comercializa ambientadores y tiene una fritanga los fines de semana y Lucia vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The "El Santo Tomas" group is made up of three enterprising and hard-working people. Angela is the coordinator of the group. She is 30 and sells clothing, especially for children and teens. She started this business with her mother-in-law, who is the one who travels and sends her the merchandise. 

She is the mother of three children, ages 10, 6, and 4. Her goal is to manage to have a store. 

The other members are María Carlota who sells air fresheners, and has a fried food stall on weekends; and Lucía who sells clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as children's clothing.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en:
Megi is a 42-year-old teacher from the village of Pereta, West Georgia.  She is married and lives with her husband, Tengiz, and two sons who are 19 and 16 years old.  The elder son is a student and the younger one goes to school.  Along with her main job, Megi is working on the family agricultural business.  They own a small dairy farm with two milk cows.  Megi produces cheese and sells it to local dairy products retailers.  The family also owns a plot of land with 1,500 vine trees.  Tengiz produces wine and vodka and to sell at the local market.  Along with the vine trees, the family owns a plot of land where peach trees are grown.  Megi sells harvested peaches at the local open market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Megi is requesting a loan to purchase additional peach saplings.  She will plant the purchased saplings on family owned land and harvest more peaches in two-three years, which will bring more income to the family.  Megi will use the additional income for financing the education of her children.

loans.use: purchase peach tree saplings.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne still sells handicrafts and the business is doing well. This is her second loan term with KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. She will use the funds to buy more curios for sale. Carolyne hopes to start exporting the curios in the future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is married with two children, ages 3 and 5. Both are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he farms to get more output, pay school fees and put away some savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said is a 29-year-old charcoal seller in Mombasa.  He is a married father of one and has been doing this business for the past two years with success.  This is his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business.  He plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to his customers.  He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further.  He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kator. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 38 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 
Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is married with six children between the ages of 2 and 18.   All are enrolled in school except the youngest.  His wife works as a farmer.  He has been a rice farmer for three years.  He would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to hire support labor to get the best harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and save money.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire labor.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo es un artesano que vive en Galapa, un municipio de tradición artesanal, ubicado  en la Costa Caribe de Colombia y a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Él es Artesano y la materia prima de sus productos son el  bejuco y la madera, con los que fabrica  especialmente canastas  en distintos tamaños y formas, que comercializa en floristerías de los departamentos de Guajira y Cesar; él y su esposa toman los pedidos de las floristerías en estas ciudades y cuando hay mucha demanda,  piden a un vecino que le colabore desde su casa y responden  a su clientela directamente, es decir viajan él y su esposa ara llevar los productos, eso si, distribuyendo efectivamente sus tareas.  Su experiencia la adquirió como ayudante de su cuñado con quien trabajaba ese arte y dos años después inició su propio negocio. Su grupo familiar lo conforman su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas de 19 y 16 años respectivamente. En su negocio vende permanentemente y sus ventas mensuales, le permiten responde a los gastos del hogar y reinvertir, pero poco a poco su clientela ha ido creciendo y por eso debe aumentar sus posibilidades de compra mediante un crédito para capital de trabajo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, con los cuales planea ganar descuentos por compras al por mayor y también adecuará su motor de corte de madera en un mueble de este mismo material. Su meta es organizar más adecuadamente su microempresa y más adelante es generar fuentes de empleo para un amigo, aumentando sus posibilidades de producción mediante mas capital de trabajo y el ensanchamiento de su clientela.
texts.en:
Pablo is a craftsman that lives in Galapa, a municipality with crafting traditions, located in Costa Caribe, Colombia, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  He is a craftsman and works with materials such as straw and wood, with which he makes baskets of different sizes and shapes that he sells in flower shops of the departments of Guajira and Cesar; he and his wife take orders from the flower shops at these cities and when there is a lot of demand, they ask a neighbour to help them at home to serve clients directly, he and his wife travel to deliver the products by efficiently splitting their tasks.
He got his experience by helping his brother in law who used to work doing this art, two years later he started his own business.  His family is formed by his wife and two daughters ages 19 and 16.  In his business he sells on cash and monthly credit terms, this allows him to cover home expenses and reinvest, his client base has slowly expanded and he has to increase his possibilities to purchase by getting a loan to have working capital.  This is the reason why he comes to credikiva and with this loan he will purchase raw materials at wholesale, to get discounts on the volume and he will also set up his wood saw on a stand made also of wood.  His goal is to organize his small enterprise and later on generate a job for a friend and increase his possibilities of production through more working capital and expansion of his client base.

loans.use: to buy materials such as straw and wood at wholesale and to set up his wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, trabaja como chofer en una empresa repartiendo productos de abarrotes.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de muros de una habitación de su casa para brindar comodidad a su familia.
Juan, es casado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan works as a driver for a company that delivers groceries. The loan he is requesting will be used to build walls for a room in his house so that his family will be more comfortable. Juan is married and has three children. They live in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time he has worked with IMPRO and the third time with Kiva.

loans.use: to build the walls for a room in his house.

loans.name: Mario Reynell

texts.es: El señor Mario se dedica a su pequeño negocio de Pulperia, donde vende productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, aceite entre otros, con 08 años de antigüedad y lo tiene en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, atiende todos los días y  realiza las compras una vez a la semana en el mercado de su comunidad, el soltero, tiene su propia vivienda y vehículo que es donde traslada los productos, gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio ha logrado hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder ofrecer otros productos a sus clientes. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 5,000.00 para la compra de productos para su pulpería.
texts.en: Mario has a small grocery store business where he sells goods like rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread and oil among other things. He has had this business for 8 years, and it is located in the house where he lives in the city of San Lorenzo. He tends his store every day and makes his purchases once a week in the “El Soltero” community market. He has his own home and vehicle, which is where he transports the products. Thanks to the income that he receives from his business, he has managed to make improvements to his home. His dream is for his business to grow and to be able to offer other products to his customers. He is requesting this loan of 5,000.00 lempiras for the purchase of products for his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, oil, sodas and other products for his business.
